text:
I am trying to use image link to anchor tag but URL is looking like this so download attribute is not working properly.
```<a href="<https://f.HubSpotusercontent20.net/hubfs/portalID/shutterstock_1086793355.jpg>" download>Download</a>```
But in image tag SRC is looks like this
```<img src="<https://www.wedolo.de/hubfs/shutterstock_1086793355.jpg>" alt="image" />```
I canâ€™t get why this is happening cause *I used same variable to past URL*, Strange :thinking_face:

*Running in an error*:
The CSS minifier strip my % sign from a custom var:
`--main-color-s: 0%;`
I assume this is because it assumes it can be stripped safetly, tho its breaking my hsl() lol.
For the sake of expanation:
I have the hsl() color split in 3 vars like

```--main-color-h: 0;
--main-color-s: 0%;
--main-color-l: 20%;  ```
Because that way I can generate the main and accents like
```--main-color: hla(var(--main-color-h), 
                  var(--main-color-s),
                  var(--main-color-l));


--main-color-accent: hla(var(--main-color-h), 
                         var(--main-color-s),
                    cal( var(--main-color-l) + 10%));```
For now bypassing with:
`--main-color-s: 1%;`:face_with_rolling_eyes:
Tagging <@U2H3TT8F2> because we talked recently about the minificator :stuck_out_tongue:
the problem is that the minifier runs after HubL so I don't think that would solve it :thinking_face:
nope, I noticed it was being stripped because the color wasn't working :sweat:
Hmm. Does it have to be hla?
well, its not mandatory but I am testing some useful tricks with it (like the mentioned earlier were you can generate accent colors thanks to how hla works)
And it's pretty much universally supported
and more readable when you get used to the syntax
and no more tricks with opacity or different colors or vars as you can use hsla() (if you have your color split in different css vars as prev showed)
If you send me your accountId I can ungate your for our new CSS minifier that fixes many bugs like these
